title: How to make the motion of AI vehicle in Beamng obey the script node
body:
Hi, In my scenario, there is only an AI vehicle and a controlled vehicle. I want to slow down the AI vehicle after it quickly overtook the controlled vehicle in Beamng. I tried to use the script node to control the movement of AI vehicle. But I found that even though I use the function 'time.sleep(0.1)', the speed of AI is low and the AI vehicle make strange noises before the overtaking . Besides, after the AI vehicle overtakes, it moves strangely, with a sinusoidal-like trajectory. But the script node I set is a straight-line trajectory after it overtook. I'm exceedingly confused. My code is shown below. Can you help me? Looking forward to your reply! Thanks very much!

def getAiScript0(orig=(0, -10, 0),tb=0):
    script = list()
    for i in range(3600):
        node = {
            'x': orig[0],
            'y': -i * 20 + orig[1],
            'z': orig[2],
            't': i+tb,
        }
        script.append(node) # drive with high speed, before overtaking
    return script 

def getAiScript2(orig=(0, -10, 0),tb=0):
    script = list()
    for i in range(3600):
        node = {
            'x': orig[0],
            'y': -i * 3 + orig[1],
            'z': orig[2],
            't': i+tb,
        }
        script.append(node) # drive with low speed,after overtaking
    return script 


def resetAiScript0(script, pos_x):
    for node in script:
        node['x'] = pos_x
    return script


beamng.open()
scenario = Scenario('smallgrid', 'test')
veh_cont = Vehicle('ego_vehicle', model='etk800', licence='control')
veh_auto1 = Vehicle('ai_vehicle1', model='etki', licence='auto', colour="Red")

electrics = Electrics()
electrics1 = Electrics()
veh_cont.attach_sensor('electrics', electrics)
veh_auto1.attach_sensor('electrics', electrics1)

timer = Timer()
timer1 = Timer()
veh_cont.attach_sensor('timer', timer)
veh_auto1.attach_sensor('timer', timer1)


damage = Damage()
damage1 = Damage()
veh_cont.attach_sensor('damage', damage)
veh_auto1.attach_sensor('damage', damage1)

posCon = (-2, -100, 0.40)
posAuto1 = (2, -100, 0.40)

scenario.add_vehicle(veh_cont, pos=(0, 0, 0.4), rot=(0, 0, 0))
scenario.add_vehicle(veh_auto1, pos=(0, -10, 0.4), rot=(0, 0, 0))

scenario.make(beamng)
beamng.load_scenario(scenario)

beamng.teleport_vehicle(veh_cont.vid, posCon, rot=(0, 0, 0))
beamng.teleport_vehicle(veh_auto1.vid, posAuto1, rot=(0, 0, 0))

beamng.switch_vehicle(veh_cont)
script1 = getAiScript0(posAuto1)

beamng.start_scenario()

veh_auto1.ai_set_script(script1)

while True:
    same1 = 0

    sensors = beamng.poll_sensors(veh_cont)
    veh_cont.update_vehicle()

    sensors1 = beamng.poll_sensors(veh_auto1)
    veh_auto1.update_vehicle()

    pos0 = veh_cont.state['pos']
    pos1 = veh_auto1.state['pos']

    timeNow = sensors['timer']['time']

    sameLine = (pos0[0] * pos1[0] > 0)

    if pos0[1] - pos1[1] > 10:
        if sameline == False:
            same1 = 0
            x_con = pos0[0]
            script11= getAiScript0(pos1, timeNow)
            script111 = resetAiScript0(script11, x_con)
            veh_auto1.ai_set_script(script111)
        else:
            script2 = getAiScript2(pos1, timeNow)
            if same1==0:
                veh_auto1.ai_set_script(script2)
                same1 = 1

    if pos0[1] - pos1[1] <= 10:
        if pos0[0] > 0:
            script3 = getAiScript0(pos1, timeNow)
            script33 = resetAiScript0(script3, -3)
            veh_auto1.ai_set_script(script33)
        else:
            script4 = getAiScript0(pos1,timeNow)
            script44 = resetAiScript0(script4, 3)
            veh_auto1.ai_set_script(script44)

    time.sleep(0.1)

    if timeNow > 300:
        break
